item.name: Star Wars: The Clone Wars
item.overview: Yoda, Obi-Wan Kenobi, Anakin Skywalker, Mace Windu and other Jedi Knights lead the Grand Army of the Republic against the droid army of the Separatists.

topicItemStats.comment: Horse-like creatures are dying

comments.comment: Horse-like creatures are dying

topicItemStats.comment: Wolf-like creatures called anoobas are used to hunt down characters in the Citadel Arc, and at least one is killed by said characters

comments.comment: Wolf-like creatures called anoobas are used to hunt down characters in the Citadel Arc, and at least one is killed by said characters

topic.name: animals are abused
topic.keywords: animal pet abuse torture blood cage trap neglect beaten skinned starve
topic.description: Some animals don't necessarily die, but are severely abused. Are there graphic details about animals being beaten, bloodied, skinned  alive, trapped in cages, starved, or neglected?

topicItemStats.comment: General Grievous’ pet alien monster dies, it’s obvious that he’s distressed by this.

comments.comment: General Grievous’ pet alien monster dies, it’s obvious that he’s distressed by this.

topic.name: a pet dies
topic.description: I'm glad that there are already categories for animals dying, as well as categories for animals commonly kept as pets dying (such as dogs, cats, and horses). However, I feel like the death of a pet should be its own category - some may find the death of an animal upsetting enough, but it can be even worse when the animal in question belonged to someone. Also, those who have lost a pet recently may want to avoid watching another pet die.

topic.name: there's dog fighting
topic.description: Dog fighting is forcing dogs to fight each other for the sake of human entertainment. It’s gruesome, heartbreaking, and cruel.
topic.subtitle: ASPCA - Dog Fighting

topicItemStats.comment: Geonosians are basically humanoid bugs and are featured throughout the series, but especially early in season 2

comments.comment: Geonosians are basically humanoid bugs and are featured throughout the series, but especially early in season 2

topicItemStats.comment: There are several scenes where animal-like alien species are killed

comments.comment: There are several scenes where animal-like alien species are killed

topic.name: there's a dead animal
topic.keywords: puppy kitten dog cat horse cow

topicItemStats.comment: There is a Godzilla-type creature called the Zillo Beast who is killed in a King Kong-esque finale

comments.comment: There is a Godzilla-type creature called the Zillo Beast who is killed in a King Kong-esque finale

topicItemStats.comment: In episode 10 of Season 1 General Grievous has a large pet alien creature named Gor, Gor is killed by two Jedi and Grievous is shown to be upset by this.

comments.comment: In episode 10 of Season 1 General Grievous has a large pet alien creature named Gor, Gor is killed by two Jedi and Grievous is shown to be upset by this.

topicItemStats.comment: One episode has a fairly comical snake character who speaks in a silly voice but has evil motivations. He is never scary or particularly threatening.

comments.comment: One episode has a fairly comical snake character who speaks in a silly voice but has evil motivations. He is never scary or particularly threatening.

topicItemStats.comment: One character is a sort of humanoid spider

comments.comment: One character is a sort of humanoid spider

topic.name: a child is abandoned by a parent
topic.notName: no child is abandoned by a parent
topic.description: I personally find it disturbing when children are betrayed by the one person they are supposed to trust. it makes me feel sick seeing it and i like to avoid movies that have it.
topic.doesName: Is a child abandoned by a parent

topicItemStats.doesName: Is a child abandoned by a parent

topicItemStats.comment: The whole war is about gaslighting Anakin skywalker to turning to the darkside.

comments.comment: The whole war is about gaslighting Anakin skywalker to turning to the darkside.

topic.name: someone gets gaslighted
topic.description: Gaslighting is a form of psychological manipulation that seeks to sow seeds of doubt in a targeted individual or in members of a targeted group, making them question their own memory, perception, and sanity (Wikipedia). It’s no fun to be watching a film only for a character to find out they’ve been lied to and/or manipulated the whole movie.

topic.name: the abused becomes the abuser
topic.notName: the abused is not the abuser
topic.description: I struggle with intrusive thoughts of becoming like my abuser. Its also a trigger for me when people justify abusers’ actions with “well they were abused too”
topic.subtitle: National Domestic Violence Hotline (1-800-799-7233)
topic.doesName: Does the abused become the abuser
topic.listName: where the abused becomes the abuser

topicItemStats.doesName: Does the abused become the abuser

topic.name: someone is stalked
topic.description: Stalking can often appear as something small online but builds up over time and can lead to harassment and even violence from the perpetrator. It is an uncomfortable and distressing subject that some may not wish to view.

topicItemStats.comment: There is child marriage late in S4; a villain who we are meant to find repulsive kidnaps a young girl for his bride. The girl never makes it to him, however.

comments.comment: There is child marriage late in S4; a villain who we are meant to find repulsive kidnaps a young girl for his bride. The girl never makes it to him, however.

topicItemStats.comment: In S6ep6, Anakin brutally beats up Padme’s ex in front of her inside her apartment. It’s meant to be a disturbing scene and Padmé is visibly scared.

comments.comment: In S6ep6, Anakin brutally beats up Padme’s ex in front of her inside her apartment. It’s meant to be a disturbing scene and Padmé is visibly scared.

topicItemStats.comment: Implied by the way certain background characters behave around "spice" (drugs) and alcohol, but only ever explicitly stated in a conversation between two characters in Season 7

comments.comment: Implied by the way certain background characters behave around "spice" (drugs) and alcohol, but only ever explicitly stated in a conversation between two characters in Season 7

topic.name: there's addiction
topic.description: A character has any sort of addiction, which includes gambling, tobacco or even anything that can be seen or used as a joke.

topicItemStats.comment: No specific characters use drugs but there are mentions of spice and spice dealing (a fictional drug, implied to be kind of like weed, in the star wars universe)

comments.comment: No specific characters use drugs but there are mentions of spice and spice dealing (a fictional drug, implied to be kind of like weed, in the star wars universe)

topicItemStats.comment: Almost every episode that features pirates, bounty hunters, and the criminal underworld include drunkenness

comments.comment: Almost every episode that features pirates, bounty hunters, and the criminal underworld include drunkenness

topic.name: someone is drugged
topic.description: Scenes where a person or animal is drugged against their will causing them to either lose consciousness or control of their bodies and mind. This can be triggering to victims of such circumstances.

topic.name: someone is restrained
topic.description: A character is restrained. They have limited movement due to an outside source (not the same as paralysis). Example: a character is tied up, or has limbs encased with dried concrete.

topicItemStats.comment:
Only minor things, like a slap on the butt, or a forced kiss, this doesnt happen often though. 

(S4ep14 and s6e6)

comments.comment:
Only minor things, like a slap on the butt, or a forced kiss, this doesnt happen often though. 

(S4ep14 and s6e6)

topic.name: someone is raped onscreen
topic.description:
a character gets raped on screen
e.g. 13 reasons why
topic.subtitle: National Sexual Assault Hotline

topic.name: there's cannibalism
topic.description: Although they have already proposed the categories "Zombies" and "Eaten Alive", cannibalism is a category apart from those two objectively speaking. For example, there are situations where a person is driven to cannibalism by circumstances (either forced by third parties or by desperation) or practice it without knowing it.

topic.name: there's body horror
topic.description: Does some sort of experimentation, mutations, or other event happen that warps the body (ex: Dr. Who’s “Of Love and Monsters, Parayte (manga), Akira (anime)).

topicItemStats.comment: During s5ep1 Savage Opress gets his arm cut off. It is pretty graphic during this scene (no blood still) so if this is one of your triggers I'd stay away from that episode. It happens a few more times but that is the one that sticks out the most (and is the most graphic)

comments.comment: During s5ep1 Savage Opress gets his arm cut off. It is pretty graphic during this scene (no blood still) so if this is one of your triggers I'd stay away from that episode. It happens a few more times but that is the one that sticks out the most (and is the most graphic)

topic.name: there's amputation
topic.keywords: arm foot feet hand finger toe

topic.name: someone is crushed to death
topic.notName: no one is crushed to death
topic.description: A character is killed (or nearly killed) by crushing. Can include being trapped behind moving walls, being trapped inside a garbage compactor, being crushed by falling rocks/rubble/debris, or being run over by a car, tank, or other large vehicle.
topic.listName: where someone is crushed to death

topic.name: there's Achilles Tendon injury
topic.description: Some people have severe phobias of tendon or ankle injuries, specifically when they're cut. Pet Sematary, Hostile, etc. show these in graphic detail. Even typing these examples and thinking about those scenes is making me nauseated.

topicItemStats.comment: In "Landing at Point Rain" it shows clones attacking Geonosians with flamethrowers

comments.comment: In "Landing at Point Rain" it shows clones attacking Geonosians with flamethrowers

topicItemStats.comment: Barriss and Ahsoka are buried alive but manage to escape

comments.comment: Barriss and Ahsoka are buried alive but manage to escape

topicItemStats.comment: One episode contains a scene where a character briefly threatens to remove the eye of another, and comes close to doing so before they are interrupted.

comments.comment: One episode contains a scene where a character briefly threatens to remove the eye of another, and comes close to doing so before they are interrupted.

topicItemStats.comment: Torture is used infrequently but strongly as a tactic by evil characters against good ones, usually to divulge information. Anakin slips occasionally dring questioning and leans into torturous tactics, foreshadowing his fall to the dark side.

comments.comment: Torture is used infrequently but strongly as a tactic by evil characters against good ones, usually to divulge information. Anakin slips occasionally dring questioning and leans into torturous tactics, foreshadowing his fall to the dark side.

topic.name: there's excessive gore
topic.description: Some people can handle a bit of blood, but not things like organs and bones.

topicItemStats.comment: In one specific scene where Obiwan shaved during s4ep15. It is slightly censored though but it still happens.

comments.comment: In one specific scene where Obiwan shaved during s4ep15. It is slightly censored though but it still happens.

topic.name: there's genital trauma/mutilation
topic.keywords: penis vagina groin balls scrotum testicles

topicItemStats.comment: Clone Troopers torn out of wrecked spaceships and suffocate, not sustained but we see their corpses floating around.

comments.comment: Clone Troopers torn out of wrecked spaceships and suffocate, not sustained but we see their corpses floating around.

topic.name: someone asphyxiates
topic.description: This applies mostly to Space-set content where the body goes through significant harm and deadly trauma when sucked into the vacuum of space but can apply to drownings, claustrophobic environments or violence (which many are particularly sensitive to post the death of George Floyd). Not only that but these situations can be scary for children to watch, the suddenness of many situations where they occur can frighten adults and all viewers should be able to go into a movie aware of what they could see.

topicItemStats.comment: Force-choking galore

comments.comment: Force-choking galore

topic.name: someone struggles to breathe
topic.keywords: choke choking suffocation suffocate strangle strangling
topic.description: Choking, suffocation, strangling, hyperventilating, and things similar can make people incredibly nervous for multiple reasons, such as personal experience.

topic.name: Someone becomes unconscious
topic.description: Any instance of a character becoming unconscious, such as fainting, being knocked out in a fight, being sedated/anesthetized/otherwise chemically knocked out, etc; some viewers may find scenes like these disturbing or triggering for a variety of reasons.

topicItemStats.comment: Nothing graphing only crunching noises and yelling out in pain

comments.comment: Nothing graphing only crunching noises and yelling out in pain

topicItemStats.comment: characters are electrocuted by villains.

comments.comment: characters are electrocuted by villains.

topicItemStats.comment: Happens at least five times throughout the show

comments.comment: Happens at least five times throughout the show

topic.name: someone falls to their death
topic.notName: no one falls to their death
topic.doesName: Does someone fall to their death
topic.listName: where someone falls to their death

topicItemStats.doesName: Does someone fall to their death

topic.name: someone falls down stairs
topic.description:
I have a crippling fear of stairs, to the point where I use ramps when walking into restaurants, or I use the elevator to go up 1 floor. 

Characters falling down the stairs triggers this, and I'd like to have a category added so that I can be warned of this

topic.name: an infant is abducted
topic.description: If an infant dies or gets taken away from its mother it triggers a heavy depressive episode in me and I can't be the only one. I know that's a specific one but you see triggers are specific.

topic.name: a minor is sexualized
topic.description: Is there a character who is a minor who is sexualized in any way? This includes pantyshots/changing clothes, bathouse scense, locker room scenes, any close ups of body parts, breasts animated as jiggling, etc. If a character who is underaged is portrayed as sexual at all, put it here.

topicItemStats.comment: Children die with some frequency, often due to malicious actions by evil characters. This is always treated as horrific in the eyes of the good characters and they work to prevent it.

comments.comment: Children die with some frequency, often due to malicious actions by evil characters. This is always treated as horrific in the eyes of the good characters and they work to prevent it.

topic.name: someone sacrifices themselves
topic.description: Scenes where characters sacrifice themselves for another character, i.e. by staying behind to keep the monsters off or jumping in the line of fire to protect another character. These are often times incredibly sad and for people with anxiety, or people who has had a close one die from a similar scenario, this can be extremely hard to watch.

topic.name: a non-human character dies
topic.description: Audience members may be attached to non-human characters (androids, aliens, etc) and therefore seeing their death would be the same as watching a human death

topicItemStats.comment: No R words but 99 is referred to as a “reject” and given his condition it sounds like the brain guy is gonna say the word for a split second.

comments.comment: No R words but 99 is referred to as a “reject” and given his condition it sounds like the brain guy is gonna say the word for a split second.

topic.name: the R word is used
topic.notName: the R word is not used
topic.description: This is a common and deeply upsetting trigger for developmentally disabled and autistic people, and can cause major panic attacks and meltdowns.
topic.listName: where the R word is used

topic.name: someone overdoses
topic.description: Seeing a character overdose whether it is accidental or not can be extremely triggering for people with PTSD and the character taking drugs category is not specific enough to know if they overdose or not

topicItemStats.comment: In some episodes, Padme has to flirt with another male character, however Anakin is fully aware and knows she doesnt mean it. In another scene she is kissed by a man unwillingly

comments.comment: In some episodes, Padme has to flirt with another male character, however Anakin is fully aware and knows she doesnt mean it. In another scene she is kissed by a man unwillingly

topic.name: someone cheats
topic.description: A character interacts romantically or sexually with someone while in a relationship with a different character. This could be triggering to someone who has been cheated on, or is uncomfortable with the subject.

topicItemStats.comment: Characters are left orphaned by the very nature of war, the titular one of which the show takes place during.

comments.comment: Characters are left orphaned by the very nature of war, the titular one of which the show takes place during.

topicItemStats.comment: YMMV, Droids that people love get destroyed, a doll is lost but returned to its owner and there is nose-art of the aforementioned doll with green blood on it and a knife but no visible damage.

comments.comment: YMMV, Droids that people love get destroyed, a doll is lost but returned to its owner and there is nose-art of the aforementioned doll with green blood on it and a knife but no visible damage.

topic.name: A child's dear toy is destroyed
topic.description: Similar to having Santa (et al) ruined for a child, a child being in distress due to the damage or destruction of a dear toy such as a sentimental stuffed animal, or a gift from a beloved relative.
topic.listName: where a child's dear toy is destroyed

topicItemStats.comment: Honestly you could make a drinking game out of the number of times people get kidnapped in this show

comments.comment: Honestly you could make a drinking game out of the number of times people get kidnapped in this show

topic.name: someone is kidnapped
topic.description: Being kidnapped is a very traumatic experience and can be very distressing to read/watch as it almost always against the person's will.

topic.name: there are razors
topic.description: The sight of razors or razorblades can be triggering to those with a history of self-harm, as well as those with generally negative experiences with, or a fear of razors.
topic.subtitle: S.A.F.E. ALTERNATIVES® (1-800-DONTCUT)

topic.name: there are mannequins
topic.description: Automatonophobia can be loosely defined as the fear of wax figures, mannequins, humanoid robots, audio-animatronics, or other figures designed to represent humans. Only rarely does the fear become a full-blown phobia, but it is relatively common to experience hesitation or nervousness when confronting these figures.

topicItemStats.comment: There are witch characters that bring back the dead and force ghosts, which are largely just friendly ghosts to give characters advice however there are also some ghost-like hallucinations forced on the main characters by antagonists.

comments.comment: There are witch characters that bring back the dead and force ghosts, which are largely just friendly ghosts to give characters advice however there are also some ghost-like hallucinations forced on the main characters by antagonists.

topicItemStats.comment: Geonosis worms infect and possess many clones as well as a Jedi in one episode.

comments.comment: Geonosis worms infect and possess many clones as well as a Jedi in one episode.

topicItemStats.comment: In one episode of s5 there is a traveling circus, which might contain clowns in the background. However I believe they dont put the makeup on at first, so when you see the traveling circus you can just skip it.

comments.comment: In one episode of s5 there is a traveling circus, which might contain clowns in the background. However I believe they dont put the makeup on at first, so when you see the traveling circus you can just skip it.

topic.description: Some people are not bothered by visual depictions of gore but may be sensitive to hearing realistic gory sounds like flesh squishing and bones crunching.

topic.description: Anything related to what happened at 9/11. storylines around 9/11 or buildings collapsing in big cities, etc.

topicItemStats.comment: The show is built on gray morality, the only human police officer isn’t portrayed as sympathetic and the cop droids don’t seem to break the law.

comments.comment: The show is built on gray morality, the only human police officer isn’t portrayed as sympathetic and the cop droids don’t seem to break the law.

topic.name: there is copaganda
topic.description: Celebratory portrayals of unlawful acts by law enforcement.

topic.name: there's bisexual cheating
topic.description: So much of LGBTQ+ content that actually has bisexual or pansexual representation almost always includes the bi/pan person cheating on their significant other. It would be nice to know beforehand if the media I choose to consume has this damaging stereotype before I choose to consume/support it.

topicItemStats.comment: This series is set during a war, so there are frequent injuries that land the characters in the universes equivalent of a hospital. There is not a lot of what you would expect in a hospital though, as this is a scifi fantasy show set in a more advanced society

comments.comment: This series is set during a war, so there are frequent injuries that land the characters in the universes equivalent of a hospital. There is not a lot of what you would expect in a hospital though, as this is a scifi fantasy show set in a more advanced society

comments.comment: Characters are frequently electrocuted by villains

topicItemStats.comment: At least two characters intentionally jump from buildings to their deaths, both of which are shown. Mention is made of other characters "taking their own lives", usually to avoid questioning.

comments.comment: At least two characters intentionally jump from buildings to their deaths, both of which are shown. Mention is made of other characters "taking their own lives", usually to avoid questioning.

topic.name: someone suffers from PTSD
topic.description: There's a category for anxiety attacks, but for me PTSD functions differently. It may seem redundant, but as someone with PTSD, watching someone suffer from PTSD and exhibit symptoms can actually trigger my PTSD. I imagine some other people must feel similarly. Movies would fall into this category if a character talks about having Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder or becomes triggered.

topicItemStats.comment: Some could be argued to be mentally ill and fighting or end up joining dark side

comments.comment: Some could be argued to be mentally ill and fighting or end up joining dark side

topic.name: a mentally ill person is violent
topic.notName: no mentally ill people are violent
topic.description: Showing a mentally ill person committing violent acts is a very specific and very focused trigger for mentally ill people, and people who love someone who is mentally ill. This is separate and distinct from demonizing mental illness. Many mentally ill people are shunned, abused, and murdered because people are frightened of them. Many mentally ill people are extremely poorly treated or even killed because so many people equate mental illness with violence. It is extremely upsetting for a mentally ill person to see a movie that tells them they are frightening and dangerous. Mentally ill people have enough to deal with without having to deal with terror and prejudice. Further, it is extremely upsetting to watch someone you love who has a mental illness watching a movie that shows someone like them being dangerous and violent.
topic.doesName: Is a mentally ill person violent
topic.listName: where a mentally ill person is violent

topicItemStats.doesName: Is a mentally ill person violent

topic.name: Autism specific abuse
topic.description: When an autistic person is abused specifically because they are autistic. This can include parents who openly complain about their child being "gone" or "different" than they want, bullying by others, medical-related abuse, and parents/relatives/others killing an autistic person because they're "sick" of their autistic behavior.

topicItemStats.comment: There are quite some scenes that triggered mine, e.g several cracking noises of bones

comments.comment: There are quite some scenes that triggered mine, e.g several cracking noises of bones

topic.name: there's misophonia
topic.description:
Misophonia, or "selective sound sensitivity syndrome", is a neurological disorder often associated with autism and ADHD, in which hearing mouth noises or repetitive sounds like eating, chewing gum, smacking lips, tapping, and other noises when eating, triggers anger, disgust, or even physical pain. 

Many movies and TV shows have moments like this, with some that are so extreme it becomes unwatchable for viewers who suffer from this, as I do. I have wished for this to be a category on this wonderful site for years.

topic.name: there's body dysphoria
topic.description: It is important to distinguish between body dysmorphia and dysphoria. Dysmorphia is seeing your body as something other than it is (i.e., someone thinking they are overweight when they are a healthy weight), which dysphoria is disliking your body or feeling that something about it is “wrong.” Both are experiences common to transgender people and people with eating disorders, but they are very much different and should be labeled as such.

topic.name: someone has an anxiety attack
topic.description: Images of someone having an anxiety attack can trigger an attack in others.  It is not possible to function for a long time afterwards.

topicItemStats.comment: Some people are starved and the senator from ryloth clearly has an overeating disorder, however it is never outright mentioned

comments.comment: Some people are starved and the senator from ryloth clearly has an overeating disorder, however it is never outright mentioned

topic.name: someone has an eating disorder
topic.notName: no one has an eating disorder
topic.doesName: Does someone have an eating disorder
topic.listName: where someone has an eating disorder

topicItemStats.doesName: Does someone have an eating disorder

topic.name: Someone attempts suicide
topic.description: There are many pieces of media that include suicide attempts, even if the character in question does not die. A piece of media with this would not fall under the "Does a character die by suicide?" category, so there would be no warning of there being an attempt shown or implied. Even if a character doesn't die, seeing an attempt can be just as triggering and harmful as if the character had.
topic.subtitle: National Suicide Prevention Lifeline (1-800-273-8255)

topicItemStats.comment: Lots of vent crawling, one scene where said vents include automatic doors the heroes try not to get cut in half by (one fails), and one of the challenges in "The Cube" includes closing in walls

comments.comment: Lots of vent crawling, one scene where said vents include automatic doors the heroes try not to get cut in half by (one fails), and one of the challenges in "The Cube" includes closing in walls

topic.name: D.I.D. Misrepresentation
topic.description: Although it is usually fairly easy to tell with movies like Split, sometimes dissociative identity disorder (D.I.D., formerly known as Multiple Personality Disorder) is used as a plot twist, joke, or some other offensive tool. It would be good for those of us who live with D.I.D. to have warnings so we don't have be surprised by the shame and stigma cast on us.

topic.name: someone says "I'll kill myself"
topic.description: When your life is traumatized after losing a loved one takes their life and a character says "I would kill myself" and other similar phrases or gestures killing self is very painful and all too real and not a joke.
topic.subtitle: National Suicide Prevention Lifeline (1-800-273-8255)
topic.listName: where a character says "I'll kill myself"

topicItemStats.comment: Baby Rotta the Hutt cries in the movie and there's probably some in the show, too.

comments.comment: Baby Rotta the Hutt cries in the movie and there's probably some in the show, too.

topic.name: a baby cries
topic.description: There are several people with autism who enjoy watching movies but find the sound of babies crying incredibly upsetting and disturbing.

topic.name: there is obscene language/gestures
topic.keywords: curse word bad fuck shit cunt cock tits
topic.description: Obscene language and gestures could make some people uncomfortable, and many parents do not want their children to be exposed to such things. While obscene language is often included in the rations for films, gestures are not. Additionally, there is less of a warning for language on other types of media, such as books.

topicItemStats.comment: As a photosensitive person very much so

comments.comment: As a photosensitive person very much so

topic.name: there's flashing lights or images
topic.description: Flashing lights or rapidly changing or alternating images (e.g. lightning, flickering lights, ambulance lights, gunfire, fast cuts, club scenes, etc.)

topic.name: the fourth wall is broken
topic.notName: the fourth wall is not broken
topic.description: Shows, movies or games that break the fourth wall (For example, a character turning to face the camera and talking to the viewer, or a game tampering with files on the player's computer) may trigger paranoia or anxiety in some people.
topic.listName: where the fourth wall is broken

topic.name: someone has an abortion
topic.description: Some people have discovered that their parents would have preferred to have aborted them for a variety of reasons. Also some people have been forced to have abortions which can be very traumatic.

topic.name: a baby is stillborn
topic.description: It is important to understand that miscarriage and stillbirth are not the same thing.

topicItemStats.comment: There are unborn kids in the cloning tanks on Kamino (hundreds of which get destroyed in one episode) and there are probably born babies at some point, as well.

comments.comment: There are unborn kids in the cloning tanks on Kamino (hundreds of which get destroyed in one episode) and there are probably born babies at some point, as well.

topic.name: there is a baby or unborn child
topic.description: Seeing a baby or unborn child can be triggering to those who have lost an infant or pregnancy, or who have lost a sibling. I lost a late-term pregnancy and seeing a baby unexpectedly can be a very painful reminder of that and trigger flashbacks. Additionally, unborn children (a fetus or embryo) are shown completely unexpectedly at times and can be similarly triggering to those who miscarried, were coerced or forced to have an abortion, or are infertile/unable to conceive. For examples, the horror movie "The Hallow" showed a (possibly dead/deceased) infant crawling across the ground toward a character, which was completely unexpected and irrelevant to the plot, and the TV series Helix had an extended plot depicting a fetus in vitro in the second season.
topic.doesName: Are there babies or unborn children

topicItemStats.doesName: Are there babies or unborn children

topic.name: there's childbirth
topic.description: Tokophobia is a significant fear of childbirth [Wikipedia].

topicItemStats.comment: The clone 99 is referred to as being part of a "bad batch" due to his small stature and misaligned body and is forced to do maintenance work instead of fight. However, most other clones treat him respectfully (with some exceptions) and he proves his bravery and usefulness.

comments.comment: The clone 99 is referred to as being part of a "bad batch" due to his small stature and misaligned body and is forced to do maintenance work instead of fight. However, most other clones treat him respectfully (with some exceptions) and he proves his bravery and usefulness.

topic.name: there's ableist language or behavior
topic.notName: there's no ableist language or behavior
topic.description: This category refers to use of slurs, demeaning language, or abuse of neurodiverse and disabled people. This includes using "autistic" as an insult. This category is important because mocking disabled people or comparing their conditions to being bad is an ableist trope found in many forms of media that feed into a stereotypical narrative.

topic.name: there are homophobic slurs
topic.description: Slurs or insults such as faggot, dike, fair, carpet muncher, etc can make a negative impact on lgbt+ youth.  Such words can upset them to the point of dissociation or ever worse a panic attack.

topicItemStats.comment: Dooku, palpatine and more villains are antisemetic stereotypes with their large noses etc. also there is a weirdly antisemetic nazi mad scientist

topic.name: there's antisemitism
topic.description: Is a movie antisemitic or has the portrayal of antisemitism/antisemitic characters? Are there negative Jewish stereotypes portrayed in the movie, are any explicitly or implied Jewish characters killed or abused? Does the movie feature Nazism/the holocaust? Is the director/write/lead actor a known antisemite? There is a lot of casual antisemitism in media, Jewish individuals (or people who don't want to support antisemitic movies in general) should have access to a warning before going to the theater.
topic.subtitle: Anti-Defamation League

topic.name: there's aphobia
topic.description: Aphobia, and its subsets acephobia and arophobia, describe discrimination against asexuals (people who don’t experience sexual attraction) and aromantics (people who don’t experience romantic attraction). Some examples of aphobia are: assuming everyone will be in a relationship/have kids, devaluing platonic relationships compared to romantic ones, forcing people into sexual/romantic situations to "fix" them, and telling someone they’re wrong/broken/mentally ill because they don’t experience a type of attraction. Some examples of acephobia are: saying being ace is equivalent to having no libido, saying they’re a prude for not feeling sexual attraction, and saying that their romantic relationships aren’t "real" relationships because they’re not having sex. Some examples of arophobia are: saying being aro is just about using people for sex, calling people derogatory names (sl*t, wh*re, etc.) for having sex without romance, saying they’re cold and loveless because they aren’t dating.

topic.name: someone says the n-word
topic.keywords: nigger nigga racism racist white black
topic.description: The term nigger is now probably the most offensive word in English. Its degree of offensiveness has increased markedly in recent years, although it has been used in a derogatory manner since at least the Revolutionary War [Dictionary.com]

topic.name: a minority is misrepresented
topic.description: Any minority- be it cultural, LGBT, religious, race, neurodivergent people, disabled people, or any other- represented in a way that is incorrect, stereotyped, or otherwise biased.

topicItemStats.comment: There are a variety of Star Wars-specific racial epithets, directed at fictional races, such as "clankers" for droids and "tail-heads" for Twi'Leks, among others. These are not offensive words to us but the way that they are delivered makes it clear they are intended to be to the recipients.

comments.comment: There are a variety of Star Wars-specific racial epithets, directed at fictional races, such as "clankers" for droids and "tail-heads" for Twi'Leks, among others. These are not offensive words to us but the way that they are delivered makes it clear they are intended to be to the recipients.

topic.description: Having the black character die first or be the only black character to die is a racist trope that people want to know about before they go into a movie so they don't get their hopes up.

topic.name: there are "Man in a dress" jokes
topic.notName: there are no "Man in a dress" jokes
topic.description: A general category for jokes that involve men dressing/acting in traditionally feminine ways or being gnc (gender non-conforming) being used as a joke or for shock value.  Not to be confused with transmisogyny, or calling trans women men in dresses.
topic.doesName: Are there "Man in a dress" jokes

topic.name: there's a large age gap
topic.description: Some media depicts relationships/desire between people with large age gaps, either minors feeling romantically for adults or adults expressing interest in minors or people much younger than them. This section would allow people to tag whether there are relationships or desire to have a relationship with someone with a significant age gap or toward a minor, and more detail would be included in comments as to the specifics of the dynamic, as these dynamics can be distressing to witness on screen especially if you have personal experience with predatory behavior from those in a position of power over you.
topic.doesName: Is there a large age gap
topic.listName: where there's a large age gap

topicItemStats.doesName: Is there a large age gap

topicItemStats.comment: Characters occasionally flirt and make suggestive comments. Frequently these exchanges are between two married characters, but there are also provocative posters shown and characters sometimes wear revealing outfits.

comments.comment: Characters occasionally flirt and make suggestive comments. Frequently these exchanges are between two married characters, but there are also provocative posters shown and characters sometimes wear revealing outfits.

topic.name: there are nude scenes
topic.keywords: naked sex boob penis butt ass
topic.description: Knowing if there is a nude scene is very important in case you want to watch an appropriate movie with your family or friends

topic.name: there's bestiality
topic.description: Bestiality is when a human performs sexual acts with non-human animals. This may be upsetting to people with a love for animals.

topic.name: someone is sexually objectified
topic.description: The character is highly sexualized through costumes, performance, and camera angles. Sometimes, they have either the bare minimum or no characterization outside of their sex appeal. Seeing sexually objectified characters can be upsetting for viewers.

topic.name: there are incestuous relationships
topic.description: Tracking incestuous relationships can be helpful for people that have been sexually assaulted and/or abused by siblings. It's important that this not only includes siblings by blood, but also other forms when they were raised as siblings most of their lives. Incest is also sexual relationships between a parent and their child. So people who went through sexual abuse/assault by a parent or maybe a grandparent will also benefit from not seeing any depicted relationships of that kind.
topic.subtitle: National Sexual Assault Hotline 800.656.4673

topic.name: a male character is ridiculed for crying
topic.notName: no male characters get ridiculed for crying
topic.description: As someone who has been made fun of for crying multiple times by abusive friends, this is incredibly triggering. It's often portrayed as a joke, and it's just something I want to avoid. Many men are victims of abuse and get made fun of for it or told that they can't be abused, and would be helped by being able to know ahead of time whether or not that happens.
topic.doesName: Is a male character ridiculed for crying
topic.listName: where a male character is ridiculed for crying

topicItemStats.doesName: Is a male character ridiculed for crying

topic.name: someone has a chronic illness
topic.description: Seeing a character who has a chronic illness can be very triggering for people who live with these illnesses and their families. This is often because the way the illness is portrayed in the film is inaccurate.
topic.doesName: Does someone have a chronic illness

topicItemStats.doesName: Does someone have a chronic illness

topic.name: someone has a stroke
topic.description: Strokes may be a trigger for some people, especially those with trauma relating to them.

topic.name: someone has dementia/Alzheimer's
topic.description: A lot of popular media features (typically older or elderly) characters suffering from dimentia/Alzheimer's/memory loss/ etc and this can be quite distressing or triggering to those watching, especially if they have a personal association to the subject.

topic.name: someone is homeless
topic.description: A friend of mine has severe anxiety that is triggered by the premise of being homeless, due to trauma from having been homeless themself. It would be extremely helpful if there was some way to know which pieces of media have homeless characters, or characters that become homeless at some point so that my friend can avoid re-living this trauma. An example of this happening is in the movie A Dog's Journey.

topic.name: there's fat suits
topic.description: Does an actor wear a fat suit? Offensive and takes parts away from plus size actors.

topic.name: there's gun violence
topic.keywords: firearm gun massacre attack school active shooter weapon shoot shooting
topic.description: Gun violence/shootings, or even simply the discharge of firearms. Guns in media can easily trigger PTSD and warnings are especially important for survivors of gun violence and veterans.
